# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

Here is the solution in Julia:
```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int=10) 
    words = split(s, ' ')
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
        if !isempty(current_line) 
            current_line *= " "
        end
        current_line *= word
    end
    push!(lines, current_line) # add the last line
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```
You can test this function with your example:
```julia
println(wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines"))
```
The output should be: 
```
This function
will wrap words
into lines
```
